name: 2-pyridinecarboxamide, 3-hydroxy-
Reason: 2-Pyridinecarboxamide, 3-hydroxy- has a pyridine ring as its basic unit, which has a melting point around -42°C. The presence of a carboxamide group generally increases the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, which can raise it by approximately +100°C. The hydroxy group also contributes to the melting point increase due to hydrogen bonding, which can add around +20°C. Summing up these changes: Pyridine base (-42°C), carboxamide group (+100°C), and hydroxy group (+20°C).
